poem:
### A Tilt in the Breeze

In shadows of the commons' din,  
the words of workers' rights spin.  
Yet whispers of distant charge  
echo with Farage's entourage—  
a nod to past, a fawn to power.  
Through Starmer's dawn, a rising chime,  
calls to mend the frayed line  
where right and reason quiver,  
like leaves in a gust, unsure.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer condemns Farage and Reform UK for ‘fawning over Putin’ Keir Starmer has condemned Nigel Farage and Reform UK for talking the language of workers’ rights online but wanting to charge people to use the NHS and for “fawning over Putin”. The prime minister said Labour must be ready for the test Farage’s party presents, saying there had been a rise in “dangerous rightwing politics” and those who claim to be seeking to “tilt politics". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Starmer condemns Farage and Reform UK for ‘fawning over Putin’ Keir Starmer has condemned Nigel Farage and Reform UK for talking the language of workers’ rights online but wanting to charge people to use the NHS and for “fawning over Putin”.
